original_text:
DISCHARGE SUMMARY
**INSTITUTION
**PLACE , PA **ZIP-CODE
**NAME[AAA , BBB M]
**ID-NUM
**ID-NUM
A6A/621
SERVICE OF :
**NAME[ZZZ M YYY]
DATE OF ADMISSION :
**DATE[Apr 21 2007]
DATE OF DISCHARGE :
**DATE[May 05 2007]
DISPOSITION
Health South Harmarville .
ADMISSION DIAGNOSIS
Shortness of breath .
DISCHARGE DIAGNOSES
1. Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease exacerbation .
2. Respiratory failure .
3. History of emphysema secondary to chemical exposure .
HOSPITAL PROCEDURES
1. Intubation and ventilation **DATE[Apr 23]rd to the 28th .
2. PICC line insertion #6-French triple lumen on **DATE[Apr] the 23rd , 2007 .
CONSULTANTS
1. Dr. **NAME[VVV] , Pulmonary Critical Care .
2. Dr. **NAME[UUU TTT] , Psychiatry .
3. Dr. **NAME[SSS RRR] , Ophthalmology .
HOSPITAL COURSE
This patient is a **AGE[in 50s]-year-old gentleman with a past medical history of COPD secondary to chemical exposure , who presented to the hospital with complaints of shortness of breath .
He was admitted to the hospital with a chronic obstructive pulmonary disease exacerbation .
The usual nebulizer treatments , IV steroid , and antibiotic were initiated .
On **DATE[Apr] the 23rd , at 2:00 in the morning , a condition A was called secondary to the patient becoming unresponsive and hypoxic .
This was preceded by the patient becoming very anxious and tachypneic .
He was emergently intubated and transferred to the Intensive Care Unit for further management of his respiratory failure .
While in the Intensive Care Unit he did develop an ICU psychosis and Psychiatry was consulted .
{ Due a prolonged QT this patient is NOT to receive Haldol .}
Over the course of his hospitalization his condition has improved .
He is on a very slow steroid taper .
He has completed a ten day course of IV Rocephin .
He does not have an oxygen requirement at rest , however does require oxygen with activity .
He is currently being treated with Advair and Spiriva as directed by the Pulmonary Service .
A the time of discharge his prednisone he was at 20 mg daily with taper to continue slowly .
Given his lengthy hospitalization , the patient has agreed to transfer to acute rehabilitation .
He will continue physical therapy and occupational therapy to increase his strength and mobility .
Ultimately he wishes to return home .
LABORATORY / DIAGNOSTICS
Laboratory values :
BMP is within normal limits , BUN of 20 , creatinine 0.7 , glucose 84 .
WBC 11.5 , hemoglobin 12.3 , hematocrit 36 , platelet count 248 .
DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS
1. Regular diet .
2. Physical therapy and occupational therapy .
3. Oxygen at two liters nasal cannula PRN to keep saturations greater than 90-92% .
4. Routine PICC line care .
5. Fall precautions .
6. Consult Dr. **NAME[VVV] , Pulmonary .
7. Consult Deer Lakes Medical for medical management , Dr. **NAME[YYY] .
8. CBC , BMP on Wednesday and weekly .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS
1. Tylenol PRN .
2. Albuterol inhalation every two hours as needed for wheeze .
3. Tums every six as needed for heartburn .
4. Colace 100 mg two times a day .
5. Advair Diskus 500/50 one puff two times a day .
6. Robitussin 200 mg syrup by mouth every four hours as needed .
7. Routine PICC line care with saline and heparin .
8. Heparin 5000 Units subcutaneously every 12 hours for deep venous thrombosis prophylaxis , discontinue once mobilized .
9. Ativan 0.5 mg orally three times a day as needed for anxiety .
10. Prednisone 15 mg by mouth daily to continue a slow taper .
11. Spiriva two inhalations one cap daily .
12. Sliding scale insulin AC and HS .
DISPOSITION
The patient is being transferred by a wheelchair van to Health South Harmar
Village in stable condition .
***FOOTER-BLOCK
